change.item: This is the first version of the encoded finding aid.

did.head: Summary Information
did.abstract: The Elkin Mathews, Ltd. mss., ca. 1919-1987, consists of the correspondence and business papers of Elkin Mathews, firm, booksellers, as well as the personal papers of Percival Horace Muir, 1894-1979, bookseller and author.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Founded in 1885 by Charles Elkin Mathews, the business began in the Cathedral Close at Exeter but moved to London in 1887 when Elkin Mathews and John Lane went into partnership. Within a very few years publishing became the principle interest of the firm, now Elkin Mathews and John Lane Ltd., with retail sales of books, old and new, taking a secondary place. The two men parted company in 1894 and Mathews, although continuing to publish, returned to a greater concentration on bookselling. He died in 1922. A.W. Evans, ex-curate, ex-journalist, and himself a collector and customer of Elkin Mathews, acquired the business as a going concern from Mathews' widow. Percy Muir joined the firm, as a partner, in January 1930, becoming managing director in 1939. It was under his stewardship that the firm moved from London during the German blitz to Blakeney, Norfolk.

Muir was associated with the firm until his death in 1979. He was a founder and first president, 1945-1947, of the Antiquarian Booksellers Association and played a major role in the establishment of the International League of Antiquarian Booksellers (ILAB), serving as its first president, 1948-1950, and subsequently as first Life President of Honor. The author of several bibliographies and books on book collecting, as well as an autobiography: Minding My Own Business (Chatto & Windus, 1956), he also made frequent contributions to Colophon, Library, and various bibliographical journals such as Bookman's Journal. He was also a founder and member of the editorial board of Book Collector.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into the following series: I. Correspondence; II. Business - Financial; III. Business - General; IV. Personal.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Elkin Mathews, Ltd. mss., ca. 1919-1987, consists of the correspondence and business papers of Elkin Mathews, firm, booksellers, as well as the personal papers of Percival Horace Muir, 1894-1979, bookseller and author. The correspondence pertains to both the business dealings of Elkin Mathews, Ltd. and the personal life of Percy Muir. The business papers include cancelled checks, cash books, bank statements, customer sales receipts, share certificates, stock inventory, clippings and tear sheets, photographs, book reviews, writings, and a page proof for Ian Fleming's Spying is Big Business in Britain for The Sunday Times, ca. 1960.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in IUCAT, the IU Libraries' online catalog. Materials about related topics, persons or places can be found by searching the catalog using these terms.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Prior arrangements are not necessary before coming to the Library, however, patrons from out of town are encouraged to communicate with the Library in advance of their visits to ascertain availability of materials.
Photocopying permitted only with permission of the Curator of Manuscripts, Lilly Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Elkin Mathews, Ltd. mss., Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.

arrangement.p: Arranged chronologically, followed by individual files for Charles Scribner's Sons, Ltd., Harold W. Edwards and Ian Fleming.

did.unittitle: Fleming, Ian. Page proof for Fleming's Spying is Big Business in Britain for The Sunday Times, ca. 1960
Monthly totals for 1928 - 1939.Also includes: Foreign purchases for 1948 - 1953and New books on order for 1948

note.p: Register for 1964 - 1965 includes purchases for Aug. 1973 - 1980; register for 1968 - 1969 includes various notes for 1985-1987; register for 1974, Aug. - 1978 includes purchases for 1980 - 1983 and employee wages, 1965 - 1970; register for 1983, May - 1984, Apr includes purchases and petty cash records for 1983 - 1984.

arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by subject, followed by card files.

did.unittitle: Addresses. Address books, changes of address cards, etc.
Advertisements. Typescripts, page proofs for The Times Literary Supplement, tear sheets, etc. for catalogues and individual items offered by Elkin-Mathews, Ltd.

Catalogues. Typescripts, page proofs, galleys for various Elkin Mathews, Ltd. catalogues, 1940s - 1950s
The Guild House. Application to display advertisement, drawings for signage, etc.
Import/Export. Lists of exported items, applications for licenses, related printed materials
Legal. Mostly agreements concerning share holdings, partnerships, and personnel appointments. 1922 - 1956
Lists. Nos. 1-38. Mimeograph lists of secondhand books for sale from Stortford Bookshop Ltd., later Elkin Mathews, Ltd. No. 38 is incomplete. undated
Lists - Miscellaneous. Elkin Mathews, Ltd. want lists or stock lists
Notes. Concerning individual items and collections

unittitle.title: Notes for the Guidance of Customers.

did.unittitle: Paper. Orders for letterhead, labels, and order blanks; samples of paper;
Rationing. Mostly printed instructions concerning food and clothing rationing for employers

Printed. Mostly book dealer catalogues and advertisements
